info.headline: Excessive Heat Watch issued July 24 at 2:35PM MDT until July 29 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerously hot conditions with temperatures around 102-108 possible. * WHERE...Elk River, Highway 12 Kooskia to Orofino, and Highway 95 Slate Creek to Riggins. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon through Friday evening. Thursday and Friday will be the two hottest days. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Be prepared to drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air- conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. This is especially true during warm or hot weather when car interiors can reach lethal temperatures in a matter of minutes.
